WorkItem.Description:
I am using all the time Rawr.Enhance's feature to export to EnhSim. There is however a minor nuisance with this:
 
On my system, regional settings are such that the decimal point character is a comma (this is set from Control Panel - Regional and Language Settings). Fractional numbers should be written as "1,2" and not "1.2". However the EnhSim export uses both formats. Here's how the export data begins:
 
 
##########################################
### Rawr.Enhance Data Export to EnhSim ###
##########################################
 
config_source rawr
 
race                            draenei
mh_speed                        2,6
oh_speed                        2,6
mh_dps                          171.3
oh_dps                          143.5
 
(note the comma used for mh_speed and oh_speed and the dot used for mh_dps and oh_dps).
 
As a workaround, after I import the data into EnhSim, I simply change manually the 2 commas to dots, as EnhSim ignores the system setting and only recognizes decimal dots. But the first time I used it there was a huge difference in simmed results that took quite a while to debug (the difference between comma and dot is quite hard to see).
 
I suggest Rawr should use the dot also for the  mh_speed and oh_speed values.
WorkItem.Summary: [Enhance] Export to EnhSim export usage of decimal point is inconsistent

Comments.Message: Yeah this was reported on EJ forums too. Fixed for v2.2.7
